Description: Brass oil lamp with conical base (a), tubular stem and cylindrical reservoir (b) and conical, detachable lid (c). The component parts of the lamp have been roughly soldered together, though the stem has become detached from the base and the spout is missing. The lamp is decorated with embossed representations of an angel on the base and a lion's head on the reservoir. Copper wire has been soldered to the lamp to form decorative patterns.
Curator's comments: Collected by the late Reginald and Helen Massa while teaching in Egypt during the 1930s.
Condition: Fair. The soldering has broken and a piece is missing, though the metal is not corroded.
